metadata.title: CVE-2017-20005 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - medium
metadata.description:
NGINX before 1.13.6 has a buffer overflow for years that exceed fourdigits, as demonstrated by a file with a modification date in 1969 thatcauses an integer overflow (or a false modification date far in thefuture), when encountered by the autoindex module.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2017-20005` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

nginx - 1.4.6-1ubuntu3.9+esm3
nginx-common - 1.4.6-1ubuntu3.9+esm3
nginx-core - 1.4.6-1ubuntu3.9+esm3
nginx-extras - 1.4.6-1ubuntu3.9+esm3
nginx-full - 1.4.6-1ubuntu3.9+esm3
nginx-light - 1.4.6-1ubuntu3.9+esm3
nginx-naxsi - 1.4.6-1ubuntu3.9+esm3
nginx-naxsi-ui - 1.4.6-1ubuntu3.9+esm3
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: nginx package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1.4.6-1ubuntu3.9+esm3').
